intro: Henckelia anthonyi, commonly known as the Anthony's henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
